generations.name: Budd UTV
generations.description: The Budd Universal Transit Vehicles were the last railcars ever built by the Budd Company. Cars 100–171 were delivered in 1983 from a joint order shared with Miami Metrorail, and cars 172–199 arrived in 1986 for the Owings Mills extension. The fleet was refurbished in 2002–2005 and is currently being phased out in favor of new Hitachi Rail cars.

generations.name: Hitachi Rail Metro
generations.description: The Hitachi Rail metro cars are the first fleet replacement in system history, entering revenue service in January 2026. Built in Hagerstown, MD and Miami, FL as part of a $400.5 million contract that also includes Communications-Based Train Control signaling. The 78 cars operate as 39 married pairs and feature LED lighting, digital signage, and improved accessibility.
